intro: Hieracium brachiatum subsp. flagelliflorum, commonly known as the flagelliflorous hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy habitats and has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and are arranged in a disc-like structure surrounded by ray florets. It is an herbaceous perennial that can form dense colonies in suitable environments.
